t: Proverbs 7
My*p son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
Keep*p my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
Bind*p them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
Say*p unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
That*p they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
For*p at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
And*p beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
Passing*p through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
In*p the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
And,*p behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
(She*p is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
Now*p is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
So*p she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
I*p have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
Therefore*p came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
I*p have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
I*p have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Come,*p let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
For*p the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
He*p hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
With*p her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
He*p goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
Till*p a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
Hearken*p unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Let*p not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
For*p she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
Her*p house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
